intro: Senecio goldsackii, commonly known as the golden sacking plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Senecio goldsackii is also known for its resilience to drought and full sun conditions.
